tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: 焼き鳥（やきとり、ヤキトリ）は、主に鶏肉などの肉を一口大に切ったものを、数個（1個から5個程度）串で刺し通し、調味してあぶり焼きした料理。
sen.e: Yakitori is a food consisting of several bite-size chunks (from one to five or so) of meat (mainly chicken) that are seasoned and grilled on skewers.
Yakitori is a food consisting of several bite-size chunks (from one to five or so) of meat (mainly chicken) that are seasoned and grilled on skewers.

sen.j: 日本料理の焼き鳥について記述する。
sen.e: This article describes yakitori (grilled chicken) in Japanese cuisine.
This article describes yakitori (grilled chicken) in Japanese cuisine.
This article describes yakitori (grilled chicken) in Japanese cuisine.

sen.j: 慶安元年1648年に、信濃国佐久郡岩村田の割元職の篠澤佐五右衛門良重が小諸城主青山因幡守に献上した料理の献立の中に「焼き鳥」の文字がある。
sen.e: The characters 'yakitori' can be found in a menu of dishes that were given by 篠澤佐五右衛門良重, an official liaison (warimoto) in Iwamurata in Saku County, Shinano Province, to 青山因幡守, castellan of Komoro-jo Castle in 1648.
sen.cmt: ・「篠澤佐五右衛門良重」は読み方不明です。・「青山因幡守」は読み方不明です。
sen.e: The characters 'yakitori' can be found in the menu of dishes that were served by 篠澤佐五右衛門良重, an official liaison (warimoto) in Iwamurata in Saku County, Shinano Province, to 青山因幡守, castellan of Komoro-jo Castle in 1648.
sen.cmt: 「篠澤佐五右衛門良重」、「青山因幡守」の読み方は確認できておりません。a menu→the menu,given→served と修正しました。
sen.e: The characters 'yakitori' can be found in the menu of dishes that were served by 篠澤佐五右衛門良重, an official liaison (warimoto) in Iwamurata in Saku County, Shinano Province, to 青山因幡守, castellan of Komoro-jo Castle in 1648.

sen.j: この焼き鳥の肉の種類、調理法、調味料等は文献には記載されていないため、現在のような形態とは異なる可能性が高い。
sen.e: This yakitori, whose type of meat, cooking method, seasonings used, and so on are not described in the literature, is highly likely different from the current form.
This yakitori, whose type of meat, cooking method, seasonings used, and so on are not described in the literature, is highly likely different from the current form.
This yakitori, whose type of meat, cooking method, seasonings used, and so on are not described in the literature, is highly likely different from the current form.

sen.j: 同文献には「鶴肉の吸い物」の記述もあるので、ツルの肉を焼き鳥にして殿様が食べていたのかもしれない。
sen.e: This yakitori might have been crane meat and eaten by tono-sama (a person with higher rank), since the literature includes a description of 'suimono (clear soup) of crane meat.'
This yakitori might have been crane meat and eaten by tono-sama (a person with higher rank), since the literature includes a description of 'Tsuruniku no suimono" (clear soup of crane meat).
sen.cmt: Tsuruniku no suimono' としてカッコとの収まりをよくしました。
sen.e: This yakitori might have been crane meat and eaten by tono-sama (a person with higher rank), since the literature includes a description of 'Tsuruniku no suimono" (clear soup of crane meat).

sen.j: ※この料理の文献は子孫の篠澤明剛氏が所有しているが、現在は佐久市立望月歴史民族資料館にて一般公開されている。
sen.e: Although this literature of the dish is owned by offspring 篠澤明剛, it is currently open to the public at the Saku City Mochizuki Museum of History and Folklore.

sen.j: 鍋や壺などの調理器具を用意しなくても加熱が可能なあぶり焼きという方法は、古代から行われていた。
sen.e: Roasting, which does not require cooking utensils such as a pan or pot for heating, had been done since ancient times.

sen.e: Grilling, which does not require cooking utensils such as a pan or pot for heating, had been done since ancient times.

sen.j: 山野で得た獲物を食べるには都合のよい方法と言える。
sen.e: In a sense, it is a convenient way for eating game harvested in fields and mountains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In a sense, it is a convenient way for eating game caught in fields and mountains.

sen.j: しかし、大きい鳥は、丸焼きにすると焼くのに時間がかかり、骨もあって食べにくい。
sen.e: However, a large chicken takes time to roast if it is whole, and is difficult to eat because of bones.

sen.j: そのため、料理店で出すに際して、肉を小さく切って、串に刺す方法に移ったものと考えられる。
sen.e: Hence, to serve the food at restaurants, the cooking method presumably changed to the one in which meat is cut into small chunks, which are then skewered.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 現在の日本において、焼き鳥は、多くの場合、焼き鳥屋という専門店で供されている。
sen.e: In Japan today, yakitori is mostly served at special restaurants called yakitori-ya (grilled chicken restaurant).
In Japan today, yakitori is mostly served at special restaurants called yakitori-ya (grilled chicken restaurant).
In Japan today, yakitori is mostly served at special restaurants called yakitori-ya (grilled chicken restaurant).

sen.j: 焼き鳥屋の多くは、庶民的な居酒屋の一種と見なされている。
sen.e: Many yakitori-ya restaurants are considered as a kind of popular izakaya bar.
Many yakitori-ya restaurants are considered as a kind of common people's izakaya bar.
sen.cmt: popular→common people's （違った意味に取れる可能性があるのでこのように修正しました）
sen.e: Many yakitori-ya restaurants are considered as a kind of common people's izakaya bar.

sen.j: 焼き鳥屋では、焼いた各種鶏肉とともに鶏の様々な部位も供する。
sen.e: At yakitori-ya restaurants, various parts of chickens are served along with various kinds of grilled chicken.
At yakitori-ya restaurants, various parts of chickens are served along with various kinds of grilled chicken.

sen.j: ネギ、タマネギ、シイタケ、ぎんなん、ニンニクなどを一緒に使うものもある。
sen.e: Some yakitori also use green onion, onion, shiitake mushroom, ginkgo nuts, and/or garlic.
sen.cmt: 「イチョウ食用の実」は、ウェブに従って「ぎんなん」としました。
sen.e: For some yakitori, green onions, onions, shiitake mushrooms, ginkgo nuts, garlic and so on are also used.
sen.cmt: 野菜を複数に修正しました。文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: For some yakitori, green onions, onions, shiitake mushrooms, ginkgo nuts, garlic and so on are also used.

sen.j: スズメなどの小鳥を切らずに串焼きにしたものも同じく焼き鳥と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The term "yakitori" is also used for small birds such as sparrow that are grilled on skewers without cutting.
The term "yakitori" is also used for small birds such as sparrow that are grilled on skewers without cutting.

sen.j: 焼き鳥屋以外では、スーパーマーケットなどの惣菜売場や肉屋で売られ、自宅で食べられるようにしている事も多い。
sen.e: Other than at yakitori-ya restaurants, yakitori is often sold at the delicatessen section of a supermarket or at a butcher shop so that it can be eaten at home.

sen.j: その場合、既に焼き上げたものの他、焼いていないもの、真空パックにしたもの、冷凍食品のものなどもある。
sen.e: In such cases, yakitori may be ungrilled, vacuum-packed, or frozen, if not already grilled.
In this case, yakitori may be ungrilled, vacuum-packed, or frozen, if it is not already grilled.
sen.cmt: such cases→this case,it is を挿入しました。

sen.j: 鳥肉ではなくブタのばら肉やもつを用いたものは、多くの地域でやきとんと呼ばれる。
sen.e: The type that uses pig's ribs or giblets instead of chicken is called "yakiton" (grilled pork) in many areas.

sen.e: The type that uses pig's ribs or intestines instead of chicken is called "yakiton" (grilled pork) in many areas.

sen.j: しかし、地域によってはやきとんを含めた肉の串焼き料理全般を「焼き鳥」と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: In some areas, however, the whole grilled skewered meat dish including yakiton is called 'yakitori.'

sen.e: In some areas, however, the whole grilled skewered meat dish including yakiton is sometimes called 'yakitori.'

sen.j: ぎんなんやニンニク、ししとう、プチトマト、アスパラなどの植物性の素材、及びそれらを豚肉やベーコンで巻いた串焼き料理を含める地域や人もいる。
sen.e: Depending on the area or the person, "yakitori" also includes grilled skewered plant-derived ingredients such as ginkgo nuts, garlic, sweet peppers, cherry tomatoes, or asparagus, or those ingredients wrapped with pork or bacon.

Depending on the area or the person, "yakitori" also includes grilled skewered plant-derived ingredients such as ginkgo nuts, garlic, sweet peppers, cherry tomatoes, or asparagus so on, or those ingredients wrapped with pork or bacon.

sen.j: 味付けは、主に二種類で、塩のみを使用した塩（しお）と、醤油、みりん、酒、砂糖などから調整された甘辛いタレをつけ焼いたタレがある。
sen.e: There are mainly two kinds of yakitori in terms of seasoning: "shio" (literally, salt) that uses only salt, and "tare" (literally, sauce) that is grilled with a salty-sweet sauce that is adjusted with soy sauce, mirin (sweet cooking rice wine), sake, sugar, and so on.
sen.cmt: 二つ目の「塩」は、ウェブを参照したところ太字で表記してあり、塩で味付けした焼き鳥の総称であるため、シングルクォーテーションで括りました。二番目の「タレ」も同様です。上記の「塩」と「タレ」は、「味付けの材料」ではなく「焼き鳥の種類の総称」ですので、原文の「味付けは、主に二種類」は「two kinds of yakitori in terms of seasoning」(味付けに関しては二種類の焼き鳥がある）としました。
sen.e: There are mainly two kinds of yakitori in terms of seasoning: "shio" (literally, salt) that uses only salt, and "tare" (literally, sauce) that is grilled with a salty-sweet sauce that is adjusted with soy sauce, mirin (sweet cooking rice wine), sake, sugar, and so on.

There are mainly two kinds of yakitori in terms of seasoning: "shio" (literally, salt) that uses only salt, and "tare" (literally, sauce) that is grilled with a salty-sweet sauce that is adjusted with soy sauce, mirin (sweet cooking rice wine), sake, sugar, and so on.

sen.j: 焼き鳥屋では通常、オーダー時に塩かタレかを聞かれる。

sen.j: 炭火で焼いたものが、香りや食感がよく、美味とされている。

sen.e: Depending on one's preference, cayenne pepper powder, shichimi togarashi (a mixture of red cayenne pepper and other aromatic spices), sansho (Japanese pepper) powder, wasabi (Japanese horseradish), and/or pepper is used as a spice to eat yakitori with.

tit.j: 焼き鳥から転じた言葉

sen.j: コンピュータ関係
sen.e: Computer field
Computer field
Computer field

sen.j: コンピュータのCPUであるアドバンスト・マイクロ・デバイセズ・Athlonがヒートシンクの取り付けミスなどによる冷却不足により熱で破損し故障すること。
sen.e: In this field, "yakitori" means thermal failure of Athlon, a type of CPU from Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. for computers, caused by insufficient cooling due to heatsink installation errors or other errors.
sen.cmt: 文脈上、「この分野では、「焼き鳥」は～（のことを）意味する」を補足しました。
sen.e: In this field, "yakitori" means thermal failure of Athlon, a type of CPU from Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. for computers, caused by insufficient cooling due to heatsink installation errors and so on.
sen.cmt: or other errors→and so on と修正しました。
sen.e: In this field, "yakitori" means thermal failure of Athlon, a type of CPU from Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. for computers, caused by insufficient cooling due to heatsink installation errors and so on.

sen.j: Athlon CPUの内でもコード名Thunderbirdコアのプロセスで生産された時期のものは、この種の故障が多発した事から、熱破損がこう呼ばれるようになった（鳥＝Thunderbirdコア が 焼ける＝熱破損）。
sen.e: The thermal failure came to be called by this name because Athlon, particularly ones manufactured in the process for the core having the code name of Thunderbird, caused frequent failure of this type (burned bird = burned Thunderbird core = thermal failure).

The thermal failure came to be called by this name because the Athlon CPU, particularly the ones manufactured in the process for the core having the code name of Thunderbird, caused frequent failure of this type (burned bird = burned Thunderbird core = thermal failure).
sen.cmt: the Athlon CPU, particularly the ones と修正しました。
sen.e: The thermal failure came to be called by this name because the Athlon CPU, particularly the ones manufactured in the process for the core having the code name of Thunderbird, caused frequent failure of this type (burned bird = burned Thunderbird core = thermal failure).

sen.j: その後のAMDのCPUはサーマルプロテクション機能が施されるなど改良が進み、このような事例はほとんど起きていない。
sen.e: Later CPUs from AMD have gone through improvements such as the implementation of thermal protection functions, and have rarely caused such failure since.
Later CPUs from AMD have gone through improvements such as the implementation of thermal protection functions, and have rarely caused such failure since.
Later CPUs from AMD have gone through improvements such as the implementation of thermal protection functions, and have rarely caused such failure since.

sen.j: 写真関係
sen.e: Photography field
Photography field
Photography field

sen.j: 写真の用語で、人物などの背景にフェンスや細い街路灯の柱などの「縦の線」が写ってしまうこと。
sen.e: In the technical terms of photography, "yakitori" means having 'vertical lines' such as fences or thin poles for streetlights included in the background of a person in a photograph.
sen.cmt: 文脈上、「「焼き鳥」は～を意味する」を補足しました。
sen.e: In the technical terms of photography, "yakitori" means having 'vertical lines' such as fences or thin poles of streetlights included in the background of a person in a photograph.
In the technical terms of photography, "yakitori" means having 'vertical lines' such as fences or thin poles of streetlights included in the background of a person in a photograph.

sen.j: 人物を串刺しにしているような絵になってしまうため。
sen.e: This is because the photograph looks as if the person is on a skewer.
This is because the photograph looks as if the person is on a skewer.
This is because the photograph looks as if the person is on a skewer.

sen.j: 航空関係
sen.e: Aviation field
Aviation field
Aviation field

sen.j: 航空の俗語（主にターボファンジェットの旅客機の操縦士が使う）で、離陸時に鳥類がジェットエンジンに突入すること（バードストライク）。
sen.e: "Yakitori" in aviation is a slang mainly used by pilots of passenger airplanes with turbo fans, and means bird strike (birds plunge into a jet engine during takeoff).
sen.cmt: 文脈上、「航空分野では「焼き鳥」は～を意味する」を補足しました。
sen.e: "Yakitori" in aviation is a slang mainly used by pilots of passenger planes with turbo fan jets, and means the bird strike (birds plunge into a jet engine during takeoff).
sen.cmt: airplanes→planes,turbo fans→turbo fan jets,the を挿入しました。
sen.e: "Yakitori" in aviation is a slang mainly used by pilots of passenger planes with turbo fan jets, and means the bird strike (birds plunge into a jet engine during takeoff).

sen.j: また、その鳥のこと。
sen.e: "Yakitori" also means such birds themselves.
sen.cmt: 文脈上、「「焼き鳥」とは～を意味する」を補足しました。
sen.e: "Yakitori" also refers to such birds themselves.
sen.cmt: means→refers to と修正しました。
sen.e: "Yakitori" also refers to such birds themselves.

sen.j: 鳥はコンプレッサによってバラバラになり、燃焼室によって黒焦げになるためこのような俗称が付いたと思われる。
sen.e: This slang probably came to be used because the birds are ripped apart by the compressor and scorched black in the combustion chamber.
This slang seemed to be created as the birds are ripped apart by the compressor and scorched black in the combustion chamber.
sen.cmt: probably came to be used because の部分をよりスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: This slang seemed to be created as the birds are ripped apart by the compressor and scorched black in the combustion chamber.

sen.j: なお、バードストライクの発生は、最悪の場合、航空事故の重大な要因となる危険性がある。
sen.e: A bird strike in the worst case could be a significant factor for an airplane accident.
A bird strike in the worst case could be a significant factor for a plane crush.
sen.cmt: an airplane accident→a plane crush (用語集でもaccident とありましたが、crush の方がより使われる表現なので修正しました）
sen.e: A bird strike in the worst case could be a significant factor for a plane crush.

sen.j: 麻雀
sen.e: Mah-jong
Mah-jong
Mah-jong

sen.j: 麻雀では、アガリの時の牌の組み合わせを飛ぶ鳥に見立てている。
sen.e: In mah-jong, a winning combination of tiles is compared to a flying bird.
In mah-jong, a winning combination of tiles is compared to a flying bird.
In mah-jong, a winning combination of tiles is compared to a flying bird.

sen.j: 転じて飛ぶことができない鳥を焼き鳥とかけ、一度も和了をすることができなかったプレイヤーに対するペナルティを焼き鳥という。
sen.e: From this comparison, yakitori (grilled chicken), implicitly meaning a bird that cannot fly, means the penalty that is awarded to a player who could not win at all.
From this comparison, yakitori (grilled chicken), implicitly meaning a bird that cannot fly, means the penalty that is given to a player who could not win at all.
From this comparison, yakitori (grilled chicken), implicitly meaning a bird that cannot fly, means the penalty that is given to a player who could not win at all.

sen.j: 麻雀のルール焼き鳥も参照。
sen.e: Refer also to the section under Yakitori in the mah-jong rule article.
sen.cmt: 「麻雀のルール焼き鳥」は、他の記事の項の名称のようです。ウェブを確認したところ、「麻雀の点」という記事の「焼き鳥」の項にリンクされていました。そのため、左記の原文も、ウェブ上では「麻雀の点#焼き鳥も参照。」となっています。
sen.e: Refer also to the section under Yakitori in the mah-jong rule article.
Refer also to the section under Yakitori in the mah-jong rule article.

sen.j: 北見綾野は「やきドル（やきとりアイドル）」として知られ、全国やきとり連絡協議会の公認キャンペーンソング「ハッピー!やきとりの歌」を作詞しCDをリリースしている。
sen.e: Ayano KITAMI is known as 'yakidoru' (yakitori idol) and has released a single 'Happy! Yakitori no Uta' that uses her own lyrics and is officially approved of as a campaign song by National Yakitori Association.
sen.cmt: 「全国やきとり連絡協議会」は定訳不明です。
sen.e: Ayano KITAMI is known as 'yakidoru' (yakitori idol) and has released a song 'Happy! Yakitori no Uta' that uses her own lyrics and is officially approved of as a campaign song by National Yakitori Association.

Ayano KITAMI is known as 'yakidoru' (yakitori idol) and has released a song 'Happy! Yakitori no Uta' that uses her own lyrics and is officially approved of as a campaign song by National Yakitori Association.

sen.j: 本田技研工業が開発した可変バルブ機構「VTEC」は、焼き鳥を焼いているのを見ていた技術者が、串に打たれた具材が回ったり回らなかったりする（ネギは回るのに肉は回らない、など）のを見てその機構を思いついたと言われている。
sen.e: Rumor has it that the idea of 'VTEC,' a variable valve mechanism developed by Honda Motor Co., Ltd, hit the inventing engineer when the engineer was looking at yakitori being grilled and observed that some skewered ingredients rotated and others did not (e.g., green onion pieces turned but meat did not).

A rumor has it that the idea of 'VTEC,' a variable valve mechanism developed by Honda Motor Co., Ltd., hit the engineer when the engineer was looking at yakitori being grilled and observed that some skewered ingredients rotated and others did not (e.g., green onion pieces turned but meat did not).
sen.cmt: A を挿入しました。Ltd→Ltd.,inventing を削除しました。
sen.e: A rumor has it that the idea of 'VTEC,' a variable valve mechanism developed by Honda Motor Co., Ltd., hit the engineer when the engineer was looking at yakitori being grilled and observed that some skewered ingredients rotated and others did not (e.g., green onion pieces turned but meat did not).

sen.j: 近年、焼き鳥に関連したイベントとして、焼き鳥一本の長さを競うイベントが全国各地で開催されている。
sen.e: Recently, yakitori-related events which compete for the longest single yakitori have been held across Japan.
Recently, yakitori-related events which compete for the longest single yakitori have been held across Japan.
Recently, yakitori-related events which compete for the longest single yakitori have been held across Japan.

sen.j: 焼き鳥のイメージアップを目的とする任意団体「全国やきとり連絡協議会」が「1本の串を用いる」「焼き上がった時点で折れていない長さで測定する」などのルール『セカチョウ（世界一長い焼き鳥）競技規則』を定めている。
sen.e: A private organization called 'National Yakitori Association,' which aims at improving the image of yakitori, has defined the rules "Sekacho (The Longest Yakitori Stick In The World) competition rules"; for example, only one skewer shall be used, and the measurement shall be taken on an unbroken section after grilling.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・「全国やきとり連絡協議会」は定訳不明です。
sen.e: A private organization called 'National Yakitori Association,' which aims at improving the image of yakitori, has defined the rules of "Sekacho [The Longest Yakitori Stick In The World] competition rules"; for example, only one skewer shall be used, and the measurement shall be taken on an unbroken section after grilling.
sen.cmt: rules→rules of と修正しました。クォーツ内のカッコを修正しました。
sen.e: A private organization called 'National Yakitori Association,' which aims at improving the image of yakitori, has defined the rules of "Sekacho [The Longest Yakitori Stick In The World] competition rules"; for example, only one skewer shall be used, and the measurement shall be taken on an unbroken section after grilling.

sen.j: 現在はこれに則ったものを“世界記録”として認定している（ギネス・ワールド・レコーズが認定したものではない）。
sen.e: Currently, ones that follow these rules are certified as "world record" (this is not certified by Guinness World Records).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Currently, ones that follow these rules are certified as "world record" (this is not certified by Guinness World Records).

sen.j: 現在の記録は2008年10月26日に山口県長門市で記録された23m42cm。
sen.e: The current world record is 23 meters and 42 centimeters recorded in Nagato City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, on October 26, 2008.
The current world record is 23 m 42 cm recorded in Nagato City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, on October 26, 2008.
